**Target Audience**



• Local residents of Da Nang who regularly visit nightlife and social venues

 • Young professionals, tourists and students who are open to digital rewards

 • First time crypto users who have never created a Cardano wallet

 • SovaBar customers who can be onboarded during their normal social activities



**How We Will Reach Them**

As the owners of SovaBar, we have direct access to a high volume of customers every week. This allows us to create a controlled and consistent onboarding funnel.



**We will reach them through:**

 • On-site ADA cashback interactions integrated into real purchases

 • Staff-guided wallet setup using CPS-0016 compatible URI flows

 • Weekend onboarding sessions hosted inside our own venue

 • Collaboration with nearby universities, coworking spaces and local groups

 • Printed bilingual instructions placed at tables, menus and bar counters



**Why This Matters for Cardano**

• The project converts a physical business with steady foot traffic into a reliable onboarding machine for Cardano

 • Every customer goes through a complete lifecycle from scanning to wallet creation to receiving ADA

 • Our position as bar owners allows stable operations and repeated engagement instead of one-off events

 • The initiative demonstrates a real business using CIP-13, CIP-99 and CPS-0016 in day-to-day customer interactions

 • The model is easy to replicate and scale to other hospitality venues in Vietnam and across Southeast Asia

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
**Cashback programs are among the most effective tools for increasing customer acquisition and repeat visits\.**

Industry research shows the following:

• Cashback incentives increase conversions by 20 to 30 percent according to Forrester 2023

• More than 70 percent of consumers prefer businesses that provide instant rewards according to Deloitte Loyalty Research 2022

• Digital payment systems that include cashback features onboard new users at roughly twice the rate of systems without incentives according to McKinsey Digital Payments 2023

**Retail context in blockchain**

Several blockchain ecosystems such as Ethereum, Solana and Polygon already experimented with real world onboarding through QR based payments, tokenized loyalty programs and simple wallet creation steps at merchant locations. These attempts demonstrate that physical venues can serve as strong entry points for new blockchain users.

Cardano has the necessary standards to support similar experiences.

CIP-13 defines the Cardano URI scheme.

CIP-99 introduces the claim authority and the wallet-to-server interaction protocol.

CPS-0016 organizes these efforts and creates a registry for future authorities so the ecosystem can coordinate integrations.

Despite having these standards in place, Cardano does not yet have a recognizable retail program that directly converts walk-in customers into new wallet users. Current onboarding still relies on manual wallet searches, separate installation flows and address entry by hand. Cardano has not yet demonstrated a simple retail friendly experience where a customer scans a QR code, installs a wallet and receives a meaningful ADA reward at the point of purchase.

# **Solution**
SovaBar in Da Nang will implement a Cardano based ADA cashback program that rewards customers during their purchase experience. This program is designed to onboard more than 6000 new users through a simple and guided process.



![](https://ik.imagekit.io/nrygeh273/WhatsApp%20Image%202025-11-27%20at%207.22.48%20AM.jpeg)

**How it works**

1. A customer makes a purchase at SovaBar.
2. Staff present a QR code that encodes a Cardano URI based on CPS-0016 and CIP-99.
3. The user scans the code and is guided to install a Cardano wallet if they do not already have one.
4. The wallet automatically receives a claim request for the ADA cashback amount.
5. The customer receives ADA instantly after authorizing the claim request.

This produces a complete onboarding cycle that begins with the physical purchase and ends with a funded Cardano wallet. Customers are likely to return since they now hold ADA and understand the reward process.

# Technical Flow Using CPS-0016
CPS-0016 standardizes how Cardano URI authorities are registered and used across different applications. The SovaBar cashback program relies on the claim authority from CIP-99 and follows the recommended structure.

**1\. Cashback QR Code**

The QR code uses the following format:

web+cardano://claim?v=1&vendor=sovabar&session=abc123&amount=500000

This contains the version, vendor identification, session token and the ADA cashback amount in Lovelace. The URI launches the wallet and begins the claim protocol.

**2\. Wallet Detection and Installation**

If the user has no wallet installed, the URI redirects to a selection page. The user chooses among supported wallets such as Lace, Vespr, Eternl, Typhon, Nami or Yoroi.

After installation, the URI automatically resumes the claim process. This creates a simple and unified installation and onboarding journey.

**3\. Wallet to Server Claim Protocol \(CIP\-99\)**

1. The user scans the QR code.
2. The wallet interprets the claim authority and fetches a challenge from the vendor server:
3. GET [https://api\.sovabar\.vn/cashback/challenge?session=abc123](https://api.sovabar.vn/cashback/challenge?session=abc123) The wallet signs the challenge with the customer’s payment key. The wallet sends the signed solution back to the vendor server:  POST /cashback/claim
4. { "address": user_address, "signature": sig, "session": "abc123" }
5. The vendor server verifies the signature and checks the session details.
6. The server sends an ADA transaction to the user’s wallet address.
7. The wallet confirms the deposit to the user.

This flow follows the standard defined in CIP-99 and is fully compatible with CPS-0016.

# Expected Impact
• More than 6000 new wallet users in 2025 through guided onboarding

• Increased foot traffic and customer retention at SovaBar

• First high volume real world example of Cardano URI standard usage

• Playbook for future F&B venues and retail chains in Vietnam and Southeast Asia

• Demonstrates Cardano as a practical technology for mainstream users

# Conclusion
The SovaBar ADA Cashback program creates a clear and repeatable method for onboarding new Cardano users directly through physical venues. By leveraging CIP-13, CIP-99 and CPS-0016, the project delivers a smooth interaction that turns everyday purchases into blockchain participation.

This proposal serves as the first tangible example of how Cardano URI standards can power real world consumer adoption.

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
The project creates a real world onboarding funnel that brings new users into the Cardano ecosystem through a simple experience inside SovaBar, which we own and operate. This is an environment with consistent foot traffic that allows us to introduce Cardano to people during their everyday social activities. By combining ADA cashback with CPS-0016 QR onboarding, we demonstrate a complete use of Cardano technology for a mainstream audience.



**How the project brings value to the Cardano community**



The project delivers value in several ways:

 • It generates a large number of new wallets created through real purchases by people who would not otherwise engage with blockchain

 • It produces measurable increases in ADA transactions made by first time users

 • It establishes a working example of CIP-13, CIP-99 and CPS-0016 used in a real business, which can be replicated by other venues

 • It strengthens local community participation in Da Nang through workshops, events and recurring meetups

 • It expands Cardano’s presence in Vietnam, a rapidly growing region for crypto adoption

 • It creates onboarding materials and a protocol workflow that the wider ecosystem can reuse



**How we will measure this impact**



Impact will be tracked with quantitative and qualitative methods:

 • Number of new wallets created inside SovaBar

 • Number of ADA cashback claims completed

 • Total number of new users who complete their first transaction

 • Attendance numbers at onboarding sessions and community nights

 • Retention rates of participants who return for a second activity

 • Growth of the local community group or mailing list

 • Pre and post session survey data showing improvements in Cardano knowledge

 • Testimonials collected from new users about their experience

All wallet creation and transaction data will come from the CPS-0016 and CIP-99 claim flows, which allow transparent and verifiable tracking.



**How we will share outputs and opportunities**



Outputs will be shared in several accessible formats:

 • Monthly public reports summarizing wallet creation numbers, event attendance and educational outcomes

 • Open source publication of the CPS-0016 onboarding flow, QR templates and server logic so other venues can reuse the system

 • Community presentations at local meetups and online calls that explain lessons learned and best practices

 • Social media posts that highlight milestones, onboarding events and partnership results

 • A final project summary delivered to the Cardano community with data visualizations, survey results and recommendations for scaling the model

These outputs will help other businesses, ambassadors and community groups adopt the same approach to grow Cardano in their local regions.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
We are the owners and operators of SovaBar in Da Nang, which gives us full control over the venue, the staff training program and the day to day operations needed to deliver this project. Our team has direct experience running hospitality businesses, managing customer flow and implementing technology driven initiatives inside a live environment. This allows us to execute the onboarding process consistently and ensure that customer interactions with Cardano are smooth and safe.



# Existing Capabilities


• Ownership of SovaBar ensures full continuity, access to the venue and long term stability for ongoing onboarding sessions

 • Experience managing staff, inventory and customer operations gives us the structure to run repeated events without interruption

 • Technical capability to implement CPS-0016 and CIP-99 flows, including QR onboarding, session handling and ADA claim logic

 • Proven ability to organize and host community events, workshops and educational activities

 • Experience handling budgets, supplier payments and reporting for a functioning business

 • Ability to develop bilingual educational materials and instructions for a diverse customer base

These capabilities position us to deliver the project reliably, manage funds responsibly and maintain consistent progress throughout the entire period.



**Steps Demonstrating Trust and Accountability**



• All spending will be tracked through transparent budget reporting and monthly public updates

 • Onboarding counts, wallet creation numbers and event attendance will be documented and shared regularly

 • QR codes, backend logic and onboarding materials will be open sourced so the community can verify the methods

 • All ADA cashback distributions will be logged and published as part of our monthly summaries

 • Clear operational schedules will be provided for workshops and meetups, ensuring a predictable and accountable workflow



**How We Will Validate Feasibility**



The approach will be validated through measurable outputs and observable progress:

• Successful creation of new wallets inside SovaBar through CPS-0016 onboarding

 • Successful execution of CIP-99 claim flows that deliver ADA cashback with minimal friction

 • Repeat participation from customers who return for workshops or additional Cardano activities

 • Consistent event attendance and engagement metrics that show the model is working in practice

 • Feedback collected from users and staff to improve the process and confirm ease of use

 • The ability to run the onboarding system at high volume during peak hours without operational issues



If early validation shows strong results, the model can scale to other venues in Da Nang and eventually to other regions. The combination of business ownership, operational control and technical implementation ensures that the project is both feasible and accountable.

sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
This project delivers strong value because funding directly converts into real users onboarding onto Cardano inside a live business we already operate. The budget focuses on essential costs only: technical setup, ADA cashback incentives, and staff operations. These items directly support measurable outputs such as wallet creation, claim activity, and verified usage of Cardano tools like CPS-0016 and CIP-99.



Operating in Vietnam keeps expenses low, allowing high-volume onboarding at a lower cost per user compared to similar projects in other regions. Every milestone produces clear evidence of impact, and the final cost per onboarded user remains highly competitive.



Overall, the project turns ecosystem funding into practical adoption, real transactions, and a repeatable model for bringing thousands of new users into the Cardano ecosystem efficiently.
